alert.note: Alert for Page; Rockingham; Shenandoah (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 6:22PM EDT until July 12 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Shenandoah County in northwestern Virginia... Northeastern Rockingham County in western Virginia... Northern Page County in northwestern Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 622 PM EDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms was centered over Mount Jackson, or 13 miles southwest of Woodstock, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Luray, Timberville, Mount Jackson, New Market, Kimball, Kings Crossing, Compton, Shenandoah Caverns, Hamburg, Quicksburg, Fairview, Saint Davids Church, Hawkinstown, Panorama, Forestville, Mount Clifton and Rileyville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
